Myro
Class MyroListener

java.lang.Object
  Myro.MyroListener

public class MyroListener
extends java.lang.Object

Provides a simple interface to determine whether or not key and mouse events have occurred. The programmer will associate an instance of MyroListener with each window whose events need monitoring. Static methods isKeyPressed, whichKeyPressed, and isMousePressed will then return an indication of events that have occurred in any associated window.

Usage: The following code will set up JFrame j so key/mouse events will be monitored:

MyroListener listener = new MyroListener();

j.addKeyListener( listener.getKeyListener() );

j.addMouseListener( listener.getMouseListener() );

Static methods MyroListener.isKeyPressed(), MyroListener.whicKeyPressed(), and MyroListener.isMousePressed() can be used to determine whether an appropriate event occurred in j. (Note that it is not possible to determine in which frame the event occurred.)

Version:
1.0
Author:
Douglas Harms

Field Summary
static char NO_KEY_PRESSED
          Constant returned by whichKeyPressed to indicate that no key was pressed.
 
Constructor Summary
MyroListener()
           
 
Method Summary
 java.awt.event.KeyAdapter getKeyListener()
          Returns the KeyAdapter instance created for this instance of MyroListener.
 java.awt.event.MouseAdapter getMouseListener()
          Returns the MouseAdapter instance created for this instance of MyroListener.
static boolean isKeyPressed()
          Returns true iff a key press event has occurred since the last time isKeyPressed was called.
static boolean isMousePressed()
           
static char whichKeyPressed()
          If a key was pressed since the last time isKeyPressed or whichKeyPressed was called, then the key that was most recently pressed is returned, otherwise NO_KEY_PRESSED is returned.

whichKeyPressed

public static char whichKeyPressed()
If a key was pressed since the last time isKeyPressed or whichKeyPressed was called, then the key that was most recently pressed is returned, otherwise NO_KEY_PRESSED is returned.
